SHORT_DESCR.P: Dumfries and Galloway Council requires the provision of an Occupational Health services for all Dumfries and Galloway Council employees. This includes pre-employment health assessments, health assessments, home visits, health surveillance / monitoring, specific health surveillance, vaccination / inoculation programmes, health examination / medicals, workplace visits / inspections, counselling and Physiotherapy.

MAIN_SITE.P: Throughout the Dumfries and Galloway region.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provide a qualified physiotherapy service (including additional therapies / treatment options and a wide range of techniques) to employees who are referred on the basis that they have experienced accidental injury, general musculo-skeletal problems or other health problems and would benefit from physiotherapy assessment and/or treatment.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: One optional extension period of 12 months. The option is of sole discretion of the Employer.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provide a counselling service to employees who are referred on the basis that they would assess and provide the necessary counselling service including alcohol and drug counselling, to employees who would benefit from counselling assessment and/or treatment.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: 1 optional extension period of 12 months. This option is of the sole discretion of the Employer.

MAIN_SITE.P: Throughout the Dumfries and Galloway Region.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provide a drug and alcohol testing service on request from Dumfries and Galloway Council for the following reasons:

— just cause testing, where there is a justifiable reason to do so e.g. where an employee is suspected of being under the influence of a substance which would have an adverse impact on their work or has the potential to put themselves or others at risk, or has been involved in an accident, incident or near miss,
— pre-employment screening will be carried out for preferred candidates being considered for safety critical roles.
Random testing for those engaged in safety critical roles,
— as part of an agreed substance misuse recovery programme.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: 1 optional extension period of 12 months. This option is of sole discretion of the Employer.

TITLE.P: Occupational Health Services including Employee Assistance Programme

MAIN_SITE.P: Throughout the Dumfries and Galloway Region.

SHORT_DESCR.P: A comprehensive OHS is required to preserve and enhance the health of employees and to advise the Council on all matters regarding health and, in particular, the health of its employees at work to meet with current Government initiatives on healthy workplaces.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: 1 optional extension period of 12 months. This option is of sole discretion of the Employer.

SUITABILITY.P: Occupational Health Consultant: Member of the Faculty of Occupational Medicine of the Royal College of Physicians (MFOM) or equivalent.

Occupational Health Physician: Associate membership of the Faculty of Occupational Health (AFOM) or as revised by the BMA. Occupational Medical Committee; or a minimum of the Occupational Health Diploma or an equivalent qualification issued by a competent authority in an EEA.
Nursing Staff: Occupational Health Nursing Diploma / Degree or equivalent with minimum 3 years suitable experience in Occupational Health.
Physiotherapy: Members of the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy.
Counsellor: Qualified and experienced practitioners and member of the British Association for Counselling and Physiotherapy.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The bidder should provide its yearly turnover for the number of financial years specified in the relevant Contract Notice.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Bidders will be required to have a minimum yearly turnover of 200K (2 x 100 k) for the last 2 years.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Occupational Health Consultant: Member of the Faculty of Occupational Medicine of the Royal College of Physicians (MFOM) or equivalent.

Occupational Health Physician: Associate membership of the Faculty of Occupational Health (AFOM) or as revised by the BMA Occupational Medical Committee; or a minimum of the Occupational Health Diploma or an equivalent qualification issued by a competent authority in an EEA.
Nursing Staff: Occupational Health Nursing Diploma / Degree or equivalent with minimum 3 years suitable experience in Occupational Health.
Physiotherapy: Members of the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy.
Counsellor: Qualified and experienced practitioners and member of the British Association for Counselling and Physiotherapy.

REFERENCE_TO_LAW.P: Professional Bodies for Medicine and Nursing and Workplace Legislation.

ESTIMATED_TIMING.P: If optional extension not used January 2021.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: The Authority will notify economic operators who submitted a tender, of its decision to award the contract which notification will contain among other information, a summary of the reasons why the economic operator was unsuccessful. The notification will incorporate a “standstill period” of a minimum of 10 clear calendar days (or a minimum of 15 if the communication method used is not electronic) between the date on which the Authority dispatches the notice and the date on which the Authority proposes to make an award pursuant to this procurement. The bringing of court proceedings against the Authority during the standstill period will automatically continue the prohibition on entering into the contract until the court proceedings are determined, discontinued or disposed of, or the court, by interim order, brings to an end the prohibition. The remedies that may be awarded by the courts before the contract has been entered into include the setting aside of the decision to award the contract to the winning tenderer. The bringing of court proceedings against the Authority after the contract has been entered into will not affect the contract unless grounds for the imposition of special penalties under the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015 can be established. Otherwise the remedies that may be awarded by the courts where the contract has been entered into are limited to the award of damages. Economic operators are entitled to write to the Authority after receipt of the notification should they.

Require further clarification. The Authority will respond within 15 clays of such a written request, but it should be noted that receipt by the Authority of such request during the standstill period may not prevent the Authority from awarding the contract following the expiry of the standstill period. Where an economic operator is dissatisfied with the Authority's response.

To its request for clarification, or considers that the contract has been concluded in breach of The Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015, such economic operator is advised to promptly seek independent legal advice.
